steps.title: Task Creation Flow – open form page
details: User lands on /add page; form fields visible, but typography & spacing already feel inconsistent.

steps.title: Task Creation Flow – submit empty form
details: Clicking “Create Task” shows no validation copy; test times-out looking for helper text ‘Task Name * is required’. Journey blocked.

steps.title: Task Completion – view home list
details: Homepage loads, but alignment issues noted.

steps.title: Task Completion – mark task done
details: Checkbox to complete a task is not found; user can’t mark item complete, so progress-bar and badge steps never exercised.

steps.title: Task Sharing – verify key hero copy
details: Expected tagline (“Stay focused, stay productive.”) not rendered, causing uncertainty about page load integrity; rest of share flow never reached.

steps.title: PWA Install – wait for prompt
details: App loads but install prompt doesn’t appear; user can’t proceed with install or offline checks.

steps.title: Theme Switching – look for dark-mode toggle
details: UI lacks obvious dark-mode control; theme customisation stops here.

steps.title: Data Import / Export – land on transfer page
details: Transfer page opens, but rest of import/export flow still pending in running test.

emotional_arc: Initial curiosity and optimism on page load → mild visual unease (inconsistent spacing/typography) → growing confusion when basic actions (validation errors, checkbox, dark-mode toggle) don’t appear → repeated blockers create frustration and loss of confidence; user abandons advanced features (sharing, PWA, theme, data transfer) before completion.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Without inline error messages, users don’t know why a form submission fails and may assume the app is broken.
next_actions: Show required-field helper text immediately on blur or submit.
Ensure ARIA attributes for screen-reader feedback.
Unit-test for presence of helper text strings.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Discoverability of interactive controls (checkbox, dark-mode toggle, PWA prompt)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Key tasks—completing items, switching themes, installing the app—are impossible if controls are hidden or conditionally rendered without cues.
next_actions: Keep completion checkbox always visible; enlarge hit-area.
Place dark-mode toggle in persistent header or settings icon with label.
Provide fallback ‘Install App’ button if browser suppresses automatic PWA prompt.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent typography and margins make the product feel unfinished and reduce scannability.
next_actions: Adopt a type scale (e.g., 16/20/24/32) and apply via design tokens.
Use consistent 8-pt spacing grid; audit with automated linting.
Update CSS to align labels with inputs.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Low contrast hurts accessibility; unclear buttons reduce click confidence.
next_actions: Run WCAG contrast audit; adjust palette.
Standardize button sizes, corner radius, and states (hover, focus).

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Missing slogan copy caused test failure and user doubt that the page fully loaded.
next_actions: Ensure skeleton loaders or explicit empty-state components render regardless of data.
Add tests to confirm hero copy renders.

first_tackles.description: Implement and test required-field validation messages on the task-creation form.
Expose completion checkbox visually at all breakpoints; confirm it’s keyboard-focusable.
Add explicit ‘Install App’ button & surface dark-mode toggle in header for discoverability.
Apply global typography & 8-pt spacing tokens to fix immediate visual inconsistency.
Run quick WCAG contrast fixes on text/background pairs to clear accessibility blockers.
